thread.title: Trump readies slew of new orders targeting EPA
thread.title_full: Trump readies slew of new orders targeting EPA | Washington Examiner

author: John Siciliano
title: Trump readies slew of new orders targeting EPA
text:
President Trump is planning to issue executive orders this week to begin rolling back the centerpiece of President Obama 's climate change agenda with several other regulations.
Trump is expected to soon issue the orders targeting regulations put into place by the Environmental Protection Agency, including the Clean Power Plan, which directs states to cut greenhouse gas emissions from existing power plants.
The EPA climate plan was halted a year ago by the Supreme Court until the courts can rule on litigation by 28 state attorneys general, the coal industry and hundreds of individual companies and industry groups.
The order is expected to direct the agency to redo the climate change rule, which would be different from asking the agency to rescind the regulation altogether. Ultimately, direction on what to do about the greenhouse gas rule will have to come from the courts.
Stay abreast of the latest developments from nation's capital and beyond with curated News Alerts   news desk and delivered to your inbox.
Sorry, there was a problem processing your email signup. Please try again later. Processing... Thank you for signing up for Washington Examiner News Alerts. You should receive your first alert soon! But Trump isn't planning on stopping there. The president also will issue a separate order targeting the EPA's Waters of the U.S. Rule, which greatly expanded the agency's jurisdiction over waterways to include everything from major waterways to drainage ponds on private lands. Both the Clean Power Plan and the Waters of the U.S. Rule have been long-time targets of the Republican Party.
Reports also say to expect a third Trump action to end the Department of Interior's moratorium on new coal mining leases put in place by the Obama administration.
EPA officials told Reuters that they were told to expect the executive actions shortly after EPA Administrator Scott Pruitt was confirmed, but the exact timing of the orders is unknown.
Pruitt was confirmed by the Senate on Friday and sworn in as the nation's 14th EPA administrator. He addressed EPA employees briefly Tuesday during his first full day as as head of the agency.
Also   Trump slams 'planned' protests at GOP town halls 
President Trump claimed on Tuesday that "liberal activists" are purposely targeting Republican lawmakers who have held town halls since the new administration took over.
"The so-called angry crowds in home districts of some Republicans are actually, in numerous cases, planned out by liberal activists," the president wrote on Twitter.
House Oversight Committee Chairman Jason Chaffetz, R-Utah, drew national attention earlier this month when video emerged of angry constituents shouting "do your job!" during a tense 75-minute town hall in his home state.
In a similar fashion, a group of Iowans confronted Senate Judiciary Chairman Chuck Grassley during an event in the Hawkeyes State Tuesday night.
By Gabby Morrongiello • 02/21/17 6:49 PM Top Story House GOP moves to undo Obama OSHA rule Bill would nullify a rule that made firms liable if they didn't record injuries in the previous five years.
By Sean Higgins • 02/21/17 6:22
